sc.api.plugins

Interface IGameInstance

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    RoundBasedGameInstance

    public IGameInstance

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addGameListener()
      Extends the set of listeners.
      void destroy()
      Destroys the Game. Might be invoked by the server at any time. Any open handles should be removed. No events should be sent out (GameOver etc) after this method has been called.
      java.util.List<sc.shared.PlayerScore> getPlayerScores() 
      java.util.List<sc.framework.plugins.Player> getPlayers() 
      java.lang.String getPluginUUID()
      Used for generating replay name.
      java.util.List<sc.framework.plugins.Player> getWinners()
      Returns the players that have won the game, empty if the game has no winners, or null if the game has not finished.
      void loadFromFile()
      The game is requested to load itself from a file (the board i.e.). This is like a replay but with actual clients.
      void loadFromFile()
      The game is requested to load itself from a file (the board i.e.). This is like a replay but with actual clients. Turn is used to specify the turn to load from replay (e.g. if more than one gameState in replay)
      void loadGameInfo()
      The game is requested to load itself from a given game information object (could be a board instance for example)
      void onAction()
      Called by the Server once an action was received.
      Player onPlayerJoined() 
      void onPlayerLeft() 
      void onPlayerLeft() 
      void removeGameListener() 
      void start()
      Server or an administrator requests the game to start now.

    • Method Detail

      • onPlayerJoined

        Player onPlayerJoined()
        Returns:
        the player that joined
        Throws:
        - thrown when a player can't join

      • onPlayerLeft

        void onPlayerLeft()

      • onPlayerLeft

        void onPlayerLeft()

      • onAction

        void onAction()

        Called by the Server once an action was received.

        Throws:
        - if any invalid action is done
        - if the received move violates the rules

      • addGameListener

        void addGameListener()

        Extends the set of listeners.

      • removeGameListener

        void removeGameListener()

      • start

        void start()

        Server or an administrator requests the game to start now.

      • destroy

        void destroy()

        Destroys the Game. Might be invoked by the server at any time. Any open handles should be removed. No events should be sent out (GameOver etc) after this method has been called.

      • loadFromFile

        void loadFromFile()

        The game is requested to load itself from a file (the board i.e.). This is like a replay but with actual clients.

      • loadFromFile

        void loadFromFile()

        The game is requested to load itself from a file (the board i.e.). This is like a replay but with actual clients. Turn is used to specify the turn to load from replay (e.g. if more than one gameState in replay)

      • loadGameInfo

        void loadGameInfo()

        The game is requested to load itself from a given game information object (could be a board instance for example)

      • getWinners

        java.util.List<sc.framework.plugins.Player> getWinners()

        Returns the players that have won the game, empty if the game has no winners, or null if the game has not finished.

      • getPluginUUID

        java.lang.String getPluginUUID()

        Used for generating replay name.

      • getPlayers

        java.util.List<sc.framework.plugins.Player> getPlayers()
        Returns:
        the two players, the startplayer will be first in the List

      • getPlayerScores

        java.util.List<sc.shared.PlayerScore> getPlayerScores()
        Returns:
        the PlayerScores for both players
